intro: Buddleja floccosa, commonly known as the woolly buddleia, is a shrub native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its soft, silvery-gray foliage and clusters of fluffy, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its nectar-rich flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including butterflies and bees. Buddleja floccosa is relatively low maintenance and can be pruned to maintain its compact shape.
